entry.title: [RFC] [BIP proposal] Dealing with malleability
entry.summary: In this email exchange, Rune Kj√¶r Svendsen proposes an alternative solution to the problem of transaction malleability in Bitcoin. Instead of trying to remove the possibility of transaction malleability, he suggests defining a new "canonical transaction hash/ID" (cTxID). Jeff Garzik, a Bitcoin core developer and open source evangelist, confirms that this is one proposal that has been made, but notes that it is not a complete solution for all transaction types. A link to the proposal on GitHub is provided for reference. Garzik works for BitPay, Inc., a company that facilitates Bitcoin transactions.
